events.title: Brutal Home Invasion Attack
events.description: The author was brutally attacked in their home by a man who broke in with an axe. The author was beaten, held hostage for hours, and their home was smashed. They eventually escaped, were covered in blood, and were taken to the hospital after a couple alerted police and ambulance.

keyFacts: The document contains a first-person narrative of a violent home invasion and assault occurring in June 1908.
The author describes recovering at their daughter's home, where they witness the daughter's partner violently kick a dog named Eso.
The partner is described as unaffectionate, remote, detached, and prone to sudden, brutal outbursts.
The file header mentions 'J.P. Morgan', but this name is not referenced in the narrative text itself.
The document's direct relevance to the Jeffrey Epstein case is not evident from the provided text excerpt.
